description: Fundamentals of biological chemistry, including the structure of biological macromolecules and their mechanism of action, intermediary metabolism, and the chemical basis of information transfer.
name: PRINC BIOLOGICAL CHEM

values.comments:
This course is required for chemistry and biochemistry majors. It serves as an introduction to biochemistry, covering many topics including the structure of biological macromolecules and their mechanism of action, intermediary metabolism, and the chemical basis of information transfer. The main textbook is “The Fundamental of Biochemistry” by Voet.

Many students were skeptical about the amount they learned in the class. Others claimed that the course was a good precursor to Biochemistry and useful for those taking Chemistry concurrently.

The professor received mixed reviews. Many were extremely positive, commenting that the professor is “passionate” and the course is “well taught” and “well structured.” There were a few negative comments, particularly regarding the professor’s accessibility.

Students said the course required a lot of work and would only recommend it to chemistry or biochemistry majors. Students also added that the cheat sheet was extremely important as Professor Cooperman focused a lot on minutiae in his questions.
